subject: City election in Hartford CT
description: A prototype Candidate Conversation for schoolboard, using Youtube video

subject: Frequently asked questions for the city election in Hartford CT
description: An FAQ that answers common questions for voters participating in conversations with Candidates who vote in Hartford CT

questions_and_answers.q: Primary Date
questions_and_answers.a: August 11th

questions_and_answers.q: Primary Type
questions_and_answers.a: Closed (must be registered in a party to vote in that party's primary.) Unaffiliated voters must declare a party in order to vote in a primary election by NOON the day before a primary. If you are switching parties, there is a 3-month waiting period.

questions_and_answers.q: What's the Registration Deadline?
questions_and_answers.a: August 6

questions_and_answers.q: Who can register to vote in CT?
questions_and_answers.a: Citizens of the United States including Puerto Rican  citizens currently residing in the United States; Living in Connecticut; AND 17 years old and turning 18 before election day.

questions_and_answers.q: Is Online Registration Available?
questions_and_answers.a: Yes. Link: https://voterregistration.ct.gov/OLVR/welcome.do

questions_and_answers.q: Is Same Day Registration Available?
questions_and_answers.a: Yes, though if in person, needs to be at City Hall  not at your polling location.

questions_and_answers.q: Is Early Voting Available?
questions_and_answers.a: No

questions_and_answers.q: Is absentee voting available?
questions_and_answers.a: You would need to file an application. All registered voters should have received the application in the mail. This application needs to be completed and submitted with sufficient time to receive and send in your absentee ballot.

questions_and_answers.q: Voter ID
questions_and_answers.a: Non-photo ID acceptable

questions_and_answers.q: Poll Times
questions_and_answers.a: 6am to 8pm, August 11

questions_and_answers.q: Where can I find more information about Voting in Connecticut?
questions_and_answers.a: https://ballotpedia.org/Voting_in_Connecticut

questions_and_answers.q: What candidates that represent Hartford will be on the Aug 11 ballot in the August Primary?
questions_and_answers.a: The only Hartford candidates in the August primary will be for State Representative in the 5th District in a Democratic Primary and Registrar of Voters in a Republican Primary.  There will also be presidential candidates in both Primaries.

questions_and_answers.q: Can I register to vote online?
questions_and_answers.a:
Yes you can if you have a current and valid drivers license, learners permit or non-driver photo identification card issued by the CT Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) and a signature on file with DMV.

You may use the online system to (1) register to vote in Connecticut, (2) change your name and/or address on your current registration record, or (3) enroll in a political party or change party enrollment (changing parties may result in losing rights in all parties for three months). 4) change your address if you move within your current town of residence.

The link: https://voterregistration.ct.gov/OLVR/welcome.do

questions_and_answers.q: If I move out of town, am I still registered to vote?
questions_and_answers.a: If you move you must re-register to vote in your new town of residence. You must reregister every time you change your address! Check online at Vote.org to find out if you are registered to vote at your current address

questions_and_answers.q: What is the deadline to register for the primary election
questions_and_answers.a: If new registrants choose to apply by mail, the deadline for forms to be completed and mailed and either postmarked or received by the Registrar of Voters' office or a voter registration agency is five days before a primary election. If a new registrant chooses to register in person, the registration must be completed by 12:00PM the day before the primary election at Hartfords Registrar of Voters or Town Clerks office.

questions_and_answers.q: What is the deadline to register for the general election
questions_and_answers.a: The deadline is 14 days before a general election by mail, or seven days before in person. Your application must be postmarked or received by the Registrar of Voters' office or a voter registration agency by the 14th day before a general election. You may apply in person at the Registrars office or at the Town Clerks office by the seventh day before a general election.

questions_and_answers.q: How do I know if I am eligible to vote in the August Primary?
questions_and_answers.a: You may vote in the primary in Connecticut if you will be at least 18 years old on or before the date of the election, if you are a resident of Connecticut and if you have not been convicted of a disenfranchising felony. Registered Republicans will be able to vote in the Republican primary ballot and Registered Democrats will be able to vote in the Democrat primary ballot. If you are an Independent or unaffiliated, you will NOT be eligible to vote in the Primary Elections.

questions_and_answers.q: Where do I go to vote in Hartford?
questions_and_answers.a: Find your polling place: http://www.hartford.gov/registrar-of-voters/polling-places

questions_and_answers.q: Who do I call if I feel my voting rights have been violated on election day?
questions_and_answers.a: Call the  State Elections Enforcement Commission at  866-733-2463 or the U.S. Department of Justice at  800-253-3931.

questions_and_answers.q: What if I have no ID?
questions_and_answers.a:
You can vote even if you don't have ID! Here's how!

If you are voting for the FIRST time in federal election

  • you may be asked to present EITHER a copy of a current and valid photo identification that shows your name and address
  • OR a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck or government document that shows your name and address;
  • OR you may cast a provisional ballot.
ALL OTHERS:
  • EITHER your social security card;
  • OR any pre-printed form of identification that shows your name and address or name and signature, or name and photograph;
  • OR Sign Form ED-681 "Signatures of electors who did not present ID"

moderator.name: Sarah Rosier

subject: Important information regarding relevant organizations and general information for the city election in Hartford CT
description: About page for elections in the city of Hartford CT

webComponent.content:
In response to the current pandemic, the following organizations have collaborated to develop this site to keep Hartfords residents and their candidates for elected office safe and informed

The Hartford Votes/Hartford Vota Coalition includes thirteen organizations and agencies that work together to increase voter engagement in Hartford CT. The Coalition is nonpartisan.

EnCiv is a non-profit, transpartisan organization that develops online tools for citizen engagement. EnCiv's Candidate Conversation tool is being made available on Ballotpedia's website.

Ballotpedia is the digital encyclopedia of American politics and elections. Ballotpedia connects people with politics by changing the way they access the information they need to be informed about federal, state, and local politics. Ballotpedia currently has over 303,000 encyclopedic articles and offers daily, weekly, and monthly email newsletters on a variety of specialized topics.

Questions: HartfordVota@gmail.com

subject: candidate bios for elections in Hartford CT
description: a page with dropdown tabs containing bios for candidates running in Hartford CT

webComponent.page_title: Bios for Candidates Running for Office in Hartford, CT

questions_and_answers.q: Brandon McGee Jr.
questions_and_answers.a:
Brandon L. McGee Jr., is serving his fourth term as a State Representative, seeking re-election for the 5th Assembly District, to continue advocating for residents in Windsor and Hartford. A Hartford native, Brandon takes on a holistic approach when influencing policy throughout our state and has continuously advocated for equity in education, criminal justice reform, voter registration and empowerment for people of color and their communities. He also took part in passing one of the nations most generous Paid Family and Medical Leave laws. Brandon currently serves as Chairman of the Connecticut legislature's Housing Committee and Co-Chair of the Black and Puerto Rican Caucus. He also serves on the Education Committee and the Human Services Committee. While having earned his Bachelors degree from Alabama State University, he went on to pursue an M.S. from Albertus Magnus College. Utilizing his skillset and experience, afforded him the opportunity to work alongside constituents, serving on numerous boards that aim to enhance communal resources, that of, Ascend Mentoring and BSL Education Foundation (President), Citadel of Love Church (Deacon), Hartford Behavioral Health, and Jewish Family Services.

Throughout his career, he's received an abundance of awards for his civic work. Brandon remains as the Chief Creative Officer of the McGee Firm in Hartford, and is employed at the Capitol Region Education Council. He currently lives in Hartford with his wife and two daughters.

questions_and_answers.q: Craig Stallings
questions_and_answers.a:
Craig is Former Chairman of the Hartford Board of Education, currently serving as a Board Member. He has been a PTO president at two Hartford schools and was coordinator of the original governance council at Thirman Milner School.

As Chairman he had over site of the completion of the Weaver High School Project. As well as making sure that the funding was secured for the renovation project of the MLK School. Noted it is the only in the State of CT. It is slated to be completed and open for school year 2020 - 2021.

He has been Co-Owner and Marketing Manager for Stallings Tax Service LLC since 2006, as well as having worked out of the home as a customer service representative for Tele-Tech, contracted to work for Bank of America.

A graduate of Weaver High School, he has attended Capital and Manchester Community Colleges and the University of Hartford and is father to three young men, one whom is currently a Police Cadet at HPD and the other two are still attending the Hartford Public School system.

subject: Frequently asked questions for the city election in Hartford CT in spanish
description: An FAQ that answers common questions for voters participating in conversations with Candidates who vote in Hartford CT in spanish

questions_and_answers.q: Fecha de la primaria
questions_and_answers.a: 11 de Agosto

questions_and_answers.q: Tipo de primaria
questions_and_answers.a: Restricta (el votante debe de estar inscrito con el Partido poltico que lleva a cabo la primaria). Votantes no afiliados a algn Partido deben declarse parte de un Partido no ms tarde el medio dia anterior para poder votar en la primaria. Si usted decide cambiarse de Partido, hay un perodo de espera de 3 meses.

questions_and_answers.q: Cul es la fecha final para inscribirse?
questions_and_answers.a: 6 de Agosto

questions_and_answers.q: Quin puede inscribirse para votar en CT?
questions_and_answers.a: Ciudadanos de los Estados Unidos de Amrica (EE.UU.AA.) incluyendo ciudadanos Puertorriqueos que residen en cualquier estado de los EE.UU.AA.; que viven en Connecticut; Y que cumplen con 17 aos de edad pero cumplirn la edad de 18 aos antes del Da de Elecciones.

questions_and_answers.q: Es permitido inscribirse como votante por medio de la internet?
questions_and_answers.a: S. Enlace: https://voterregistration.ct.gov/OLVR/welcome.do

questions_and_answers.q: Es permitido inscribirse como votante el Da de Elecciones?
questions_and_answers.a: S, pero si se inscribe en persona, debe de acudir al Municipio (Registrador de Votantes) y no en su lugar de votacin.

questions_and_answers.q: Es permitido votar antes del Da de Elecciones?
questions_and_answers.a: No

questions_and_answers.q: Es permitido votar como votante en ausencia?
questions_and_answers.a: Es permitido si usted somete una solicitud para votar en ausencia. Todos los votantes habrn ya recibido tal solicitud por correo postal. Usted debe llenarla y someterla con suficiente tiempo para luego poder recibir y enviar su papeleta de voto en ausencia.

questions_and_answers.q: Qu tipo de identificacin necesito
questions_and_answers.a: Usted puede proveer identificacin sin foto

questions_and_answers.q: Cuales son los horarios de los lugares de votacin?
questions_and_answers.a: Entra las 6 de la madrugada hasta las 8 de la noche el 11 de Agosto.

questions_and_answers.q: Donde puedo encontrar ms informacin de como votar en Connecticut?
questions_and_answers.a: https://ballotpedia.org/Voting_in_Connecticut

questions_and_answers.q: - Qu candidatos representando a Hartford estarn en la papeleta de votacin en la primaria del 11 de Agosto?
questions_and_answers.a: Los nicos candidatos de Hartford en la primaria de Agosto sern los Representantes Estatales (Asamblestas) del Distrito 5 in la primaria del Partido Demcrata y los Registradores de Votantes en la primaria Republicana. Habrn tambin candidatos a la Presidencia de los EE.UU.AA. en las primarias de ambos Partidos.

questions_and_answers.q: Puedo inscribirme por el internet?
questions_and_answers.a:
Usted puede inscribirse por internet si tiene una licencia de conducir vlida, un permiso de conducir como aprendz, o una tarjeta oficial de identificacin con foto y su firma suministrada por el Departamento de Vehculos de Connecticut (DMV).

Usted puede usar el sistema de inscripcin de votantes por internet para:

  1. inscribirse como votante en Connecticut,
  2. cambiar su nombre direccin como votante ya inscrito,
  3. inscribirse a un partido poltico o cambiar de partido poltico (reconociendo que pierde ciertos derechos con el partido anterior por un perodo de tres meses),
  4. cambiar su direccin si se muda a otro lugar en su actual pueblo o ciudad.

El enlace: https://voterregistration.ct.gov/OLVR/welcome.do

questions_and_answers.q: Si me mudo de pueblo o ciudad, sigo an inscrito como votante?
questions_and_answers.a: Si se muda de pueblo o ciudad, usted debe re-inscribirse para votar en su nuevo pueblo o ciudad de residencia.

questions_and_answers.q: Cul es la fecha final para inscribirme como nuevo votante?
questions_and_answers.a: Si usted opta por inscribirse por correo como nuevo votante, la fecha final para completar y enviar su solicitud de inscripcin, sea fecha de matasellos o recibida por la Oficina de Registrador de Votantes  agencia oficial para registro de votantes, es CINCO dias antes de las Elecciones Primarias. Si usted opta por inscribirse en persona como nuevo votante, debe inscribirse no ms tarde de las 12 del medio dia el dia antes de las Elecciones Primarias. Por lo tanto, debe acudir a la Oficina de Registrador de Votantes  la Secretara Municipal (Town Clerk).

questions_and_answers.q: Cual es la fecha final para inscribirme para las votar en las Elecciones Generales?
questions_and_answers.a: La fecha final es 14 dias antes de las Elecciones Generales si se inscribe por correo, o 7 dias antes si se inscribe en persona. Su solicitud debe de llegar, sea con fecha de matasello  recibida por el Registrador de Votantes  la Secretara Municipal no ms de 14 dias antesde las Elecciones Generales. Usted puede inscribirse en persona en las oficinas del Registrador de Votantes  en la Secretara Municipal no ms tarde del sptimo dia antes de las Elecciones Generales.

questions_and_answers.q: Como puedo saber si soy eligible para votar en las Elecciones Primarias del 11 de Agosto?
questions_and_answers.a: Usted puede votar en las elecciones primarias en Connecticut si cumple la edad de 18 aos antes el dia de elecciones, si es residente en el estado de Connecticut, y si no ha sido sentenciado y encarcelado por un delito mayor que lo descalifique como votante en el estado. Votantes inscritos como republicanos podrn votar en la primaria del Partido Republicano, y los votantes inscritos como demcratas podrn votar en la primaria del Partido Demcrata. Si usted es un votante independiente no afiliado a algn partido poltico, no podr votar en las Elecciones Primarias en Agosto.

questions_and_answers.q: Donde puedo votar en Hartford?
questions_and_answers.a: encuentre su lugar de votacin aqu: http://www.hartford.gov/registrar-of-voters/polling-places

questions_and_answers.q: A quin debo llamar si mis derechos como votante han sido violados?
questions_and_answers.a: Usted puede llamar a la State Elections Enforcement Commission (Comisin Estatal de Elecciones) al 866-733-2463  al U.S. Department of Justice (Departamento de Justicia de los EE.UU.AA.) al 800-253-3931.

questions_and_answers.q: Qu sucede si no tengo tarjeta identificacin?
questions_and_answers.a:
!Usted puede votar aunque no tenga tarjeta de identificacin! Es as de simple:

Si est votando por PRIMERA VEZ en elecciones federales:

  • Tendr que presentar una copia al corriente de identificacin vlida que muestre su nombre complete y direccin de residencia;
  • , una copia de una facture de electricidad, documento de cuenta bancaria, cheque del gobierno, cheque de pago de su trabajo, u otro documento del gobierno que muestre su nombre completo y direccin de residencia
  • usted puede tambin optar por votar con una papeleta de voto provisional

Otros votantes:

  • Tendrn que mostrar tarjeta del Seguro Social;
  • cualquier otro documento escrito que muestre su nombre complete y direccin de residencia o su nombre y firma, su nombre y foto;
  • , podr llenar y firmar el formulario ED-681 "Signatures of electors who did not present ID" (Documento firmado con la firma de votantes que no rindieron identificacin alguna)

webComponent.page_title: Datos biogrficos de los candidatos polticos de Hartford, CT

questions_and_answers.q: Brandon McGee Jr.
questions_and_answers.a:
Brandon L. McGee Jr. est cumpliendo su cuarto trmino en el cargo como Representante Estatal y en bsqueda de su re-eleccin al mismo para continuar abogando por los residentes de Windsor y Hartford en el Distrito 5 de la Asamblea Estatal. Nacido en Hartford, Brandon se enfoca ampliamente en influenciar las polticas pblicas en el estado y ha persistido en abogar por la equitatividad en la educacin, la reforma del sistema judicial, la inscripcin de votantes, y el empoderamiento por las personas de color y sus comunidades. El tambin tom parte en la aprobacin de la ley ms favorable en la nacin en relacin al pago por tiempo para atencin familiar y mdica (Paid Family and Medical Leave). Brandon actualmente asume el cargo de Presidente del Comit de Vivienda as como de Vice-Presidente del Grupo de Consulta Poltica Afro-Americano y Puertorriqueo de la legislatura estatal. Tambin rinde labor en el Comit de Educacin y el de Servicios Humanos. Luego de obtener el Bachillerato en Alabama State University, el se gradu con Maestra en Ciencias de la Albertus Magnus College. Disponiendo de sus facultades, destrezas y experiencia, ha colaborado con sus constituyentes en numerosos organismos y juntas directivas para aumentar los recursos comunitarios, entre ellos Ascend Mentoring, BSL Education Foundation (en el cual ejerci el cargo de Presidente), Citadel of Love Church (como Dacono), Hartford Behavioral Health, y Jewish Family Services.

Durante su trayectoria professional, ha recibido numerosos galardones por su labor cvica. Brandon contina ejerciendo el puesto de Oficial Creativo en su empresa McGee Firm en Hartford, y tambin trabaja en Capitol Region Education Council. Actualmente reside en Hartford con su esposa y dos hijas.

questions_and_answers.q: Craig Stallings
questions_and_answers.a:
Craig Stallings se distingui como Presidente y miembro de la Junta de Educacin de Hartford. Fue Presidente del PTO (Grupos de Padres y Maestros) en dos de las escuelas en Hartford y fue coordinador del concilio original de gobierno en la escuela Thirman L. Milner School.

Como Presidente de la Junta de Educacin, l supervis el Proyecto de la Escuela Superior Weaver y, adems, se asegur que se aprobaran fondos para el proyecto de renovacin de la MLK School, la nica de su ndole en el estado y la cual ser inagurada en el ao escolar 2020-2021.

Craig es co-fundador y gerente de Stallings Tax Service LLC desde el 2006, y tambin trabaj como representante de servicios a los clientes en la empresa Tele-Tech, bajo contrato con Bank of America.

Graduado de Weaver High School, termin sus estudios en Capital Community College, Manchester Community College, y University of Hartford. Craig es el padre de tres varones, uno de ellos Cadete en el Departamento de Polica de Hartford y los otros dos an estudiantes en las escuelas pblicas de Hartford.
